meanings.definition: Resembling a cigar in shape or appearance.
meanings.sent1: The long, slender candle was cigarlike in its shape.
meanings.sent2: The rocket had a cigarlike body, tapering at the ends.
meanings.sent3: The cigarlike tree trunk swayed gently in the breeze.
meanings.sent4: The cigarlike silhouette of the building stood out against the skyline.
meanings.sent5: The cigarlike cloud stretched across the sky, casting a shadow below.

meanings.definition: Having qualities or characteristics similar to those of a cigar.
meanings.sent1: The rich aroma of the cigarlike perfume filled the room.
meanings.sent2: The leather jacket had a cigarlike scent of tobacco and musk.
meanings.sent3: The cigarlike flavor of the dessert surprised and delighted the guests.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had a cigarlike depth that commanded attention.
meanings.sent5: The old book had a cigarlike smell, hinting at years of history within its pages.
